senses.sense_definition: That inhibits the physiological action of acetylcholine at a receptor site.

examples.text: The doctor prescribed a medication with strong <w>anticholinergic</w> properties to help with the symptoms.
Dry mouth and blurred vision are common <w>anticholinergic</w> effects observed in patients.

senses.sense_definition: Any of a class of drugs, typically used to treat various disorders and some forms of poisoning, which inhibit the physiological action of acetylcholine at a receptor site.

examples.text: Some <w>anticholinergics</w> are commonly used to treat motion sickness and nausea.
The patient had to stop taking <w>anticholinergics</w> due to severe side effects.
